transcript.text: Hello, how can I assist you today?
Hi, I need help filling out my Elster documents. I have two children, both my partner and I work, and I want to make sure everything is correct according to German laws.

Sure, I can help with that. Elster is the official tax platform in Germany for submitting income tax returns. You’ll need to fill out various sections, but I can guide you through the most relevant ones for your situation.
Great, where do I start? What do I need to know about taxes for my children?

For your children, you can apply for the 'Kinderfreibetrag' (child tax allowance). This allows you to reduce your taxable income by a certain amount for each child. Additionally, there’s the 'Kindergeld' (child benefit), which you can receive monthly for each child.
Okay, so how do I apply for the 'Kinderfreibetrag' on Elster?

In Elster, when filling out the 'Einkommensteuererklärung' (income tax return), there’s a section for 'Kinder' (children). You will input your children’s details, including birth dates. The system will automatically apply the child allowance. If you’re eligible for Kindergeld, you’ll enter that too, though it’s already paid to you directly by the government.
Got it. We both work full-time. How does that affect our tax situation?

Since both of you work, you’ll both report your incomes in the 'Einkommensteuererklärung.' If your combined income puts you into a higher tax bracket, you might be able to benefit from the 'Splittingtarif' (splitting tariff), which could reduce your overall tax burden. Make sure to check the box for 'Veranlagung zur Zusammenveranlagung' (joint assessment) if you’re filing together as a couple.
And what about deductions or allowances we can claim?

You can claim various deductions like childcare costs, work-related expenses, and even special allowances like health insurance. Be sure to keep receipts and documentation for anything you're claiming. There’s a section for 'Werbungskosten' (work-related expenses) and 'Sonderausgaben' (special expenses) in the Elster form.
Do we need to fill out anything else for the children?

Aside from the child tax allowance, you’ll need to enter any other benefits you receive, such as child benefit (Kindergeld). If your children attend school, you can also claim school supplies and certain education-related expenses. If applicable, don’t forget to include any health insurance costs for them as well.
Thank you! This really helps. Is there a deadline for submitting the Elster forms?

The deadline for submitting your income tax return through Elster is typically July 31st of the following year, but if you use a tax advisor, the deadline may be extended. It’s best to submit it early to avoid any penalties.
Thanks again! I feel more confident about filling out the documents now.
You’re welcome! Take your time filling out the forms, and don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions. Good luck with your tax return!
